Both interviews were conducted by panels of 4 or so people. The group interview involved some "group process" type activities to show how you problem solved in a group. The one-on-one interview was incredibly straightforward and was more about getting to know you than what you brought to the table as a candidate.
Interview Questions: What do you like about living on or off campus?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview is not much, asked about algorithms and how you deal with students in regard to homework solutions and previous experience
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied for an available position post on HireMason at GMU portal. The course coordinator obtained my resume from HireMason at GMU portal and sent me an email to schedule an interview
Interview Questions: I was questions about my knowledge and experience in digital multimedia and the software. I was also asked to demonstrate my experience in the software

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: My academic advisor helped me get this job but before that, he and I had 2 sessions talking about my previous jobs. Because he wanted to make sure I have required skills to work in a large group project.
Interview Questions: Did you ever have a large group experience working with Java?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Clean, quick, and professional. They did a good job of staying in touch with me throughout the process.
Interview Questions: If you were to manage an inter-racial conflict, how would you handle it?

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume through hire mason. Got an email couple of weeks later to schedule an interview. Interview was conducted by a RD (Residence Director) who asked basic behavioural interview questions (included customer service, why I'd like to work with the company, etc.). Didn't really ask about previous jobs. The interview lasted about 20-30 mins.
Interview Questions: How good am I with technology; most are easy if you have been in a customer service position before

title: Graduate Research Assistant Neuroscience Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at George Mason University in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: it was easy with the principal investigator. He said "you can do it" We used PC-based psychological test batteries assessing attention, short-term memory  and questionnaries It was an awesome time to work for the department of psychology in outreach program overseas
Interview Questions: The university professor just said I need data from  minimum of hundred participants to draw inferences from the ageing study. Now I understand the trend towards big data because the variants are enormous and it requires statistical methods to understand what is going on in ageing brain and mind

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initially, I Interviewed with a search committee via a remote video connection.  This was friendly, not terribly stressful.  One search committee member was not present so I had a follow-up phone interview separately.  Followed up with several one on one interviews.  In addition, I met with prospective staff / direct reports.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Information Technology Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email back within the following week. They asked if I could come in to interview and met three people that held different positions for the college (one of them was my current boss). The interview was very standard with general interview questions that everyone can answer. They then looked at my portfolio website and I walked them through it. Didn't take long at all.
Interview Questions: Strengths vs Weaknesses

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I took a tour of the university.  I spoke to the Graduate Advisor and two potential research advisors.  I had lunch in the cafeteria.  The interview was optional.  So, it was as much about seeing if the Mason community was a good fit for me, as it was about obtaining the position.
Interview Questions: What kind of research are you interested in?

title: Desk Assistant - Office of Housing and Residence Life Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application to OHRL and within 48 hours, Clair Shields contacted me with an interview. The interview was conducted in about 30 minutes, and were general questions.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this NEW position?

title: Classroom SUpport Wage Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Mason University in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone call for scheduling an interview and then one on one interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Web Development Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: previous experience in web development and then asked me if I have experience in php. The interviewer also asked of the tools i used for developing website.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in scripting languages specifically in php?

title: Assistant Webmaster Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: one onsite interview
Interview Questions: simple interview asked about my strength weakness and checked if I can learn new technologies

title: Multimedia Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: The supervisors asked me about my experience in terms of technical skills. They asked me if I knew 2d Animation in Flash and understood keyframing. They ask about customer service questions. One of the questions was how did I deal a difficult situation where the other person was unable to understand what I was trying to tell them. For example, the customer does not understand how keyframing works even though I tried explained how it works in Flash. How would you get your idea across?
Interview Questions: The customer does not understand what you're trying to say and is getting frustrated because their project is due soon. What do you do?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted through a friend who worked at the university. Department was looking to fill a vacated spot on the staff. After phone interview and forwarding of transcripts to verigy educational qualifications, appeared for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Went over experience on resume with other staff members. Answered questions on technical background. There were any overly difficult questions, just coverage of all items mentioned on resume.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was at a time of transition an so it took a while longer than I would have thought.
Interview Questions: How would you describe good customer service?

title: Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Mason University (Fairfax, VA) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview after phone interview
Interview Questions: The interview was a list of questions and then a few behavioral questions
